DataElement.preferredName: Collimator Radiation Therapy Isocenter Length Diameter Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: information related to length of collimator (a  diaphragm or system of diaphragms made of an absorbing material, designed to define and restrict the dimensions and direction of a beam of radiation) diameter for isocenters in radiation therapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to length of collimator (a  diaphragm or system of diaphragms made of an absorbing material, designed to define and restrict the dimensions and direction of a beam of radiation) diameter for isocenters in radiation therapy.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A diaphragm or system of diaphragms made of an absorbing material, designed to define and restrict the dimensions and direction of a beam of radiation.:use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.

Concepts.definition: A diaphragm or system of diaphragms made of an absorbing material, designed to define and restrict the dimensions and direction of a beam of radiation.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Property.preferredDefinition:
Either a point at which there is a maximum or minimum of a radiation dose or the center point of a radiation
field where the origin of the coordinate system is (x, y, z) = (0, 0 ,0).
:Length; the linear extent in space from one end to the other.

Concepts.definition: Either a point at which there is a maximum or minimum of a radiation dose or the center point of a radiation field where the origin of the coordinate system is (x, y, z) = (0, 0, 0).
The linear extent in space from one end of something to the other end, or the extent of something from beginning to end.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the determination of the length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle or sphere and connecting two points on the circumference in radiation therapy.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Diameter; the length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle and connecting two points on the circumference.:Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: The length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle or sphere and connecting two points on the circumference.
Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.
